author: Giftea
message:
fix(curriculum): update quiz questions to focus on React keys and lists (#61070)

Co-authored-by: Huyen Nguyen <25715018+huyenltnguyen@users.noreply.github.com>

files.patch:
@@ -61,23 +61,23 @@ Logical `&&` operator.
 
 #### --text--
 
-Which command is used to bootstrap a React project with Vite?
+What is the primary purpose of adding a `key` prop when rendering a list in React?
 
 #### --distractors--
 
-`npm create vite@latest my-react-app react`
+To apply a unique CSS style to each list item.
 
 ---
 
-`npx create vite@latest my-react-app -- --template react`
+To serve as the text content for the element.
 
 ---
 
-`npm install vite@latest my-react-app -- --template react`
+To add an event listener to each specific item in the list.
 
 #### --answer--
 
-`npm create vite@latest my-react-app -- --template react`
+To help React identify items for efficient rendering.
 
 ### --question--
 
@@ -215,45 +215,45 @@ Which of the following is not a valid JSX element?
 
 #### --text--
 
-Which of the following is an example of a meta framework for React?
+Which JavaScript array method is commonly used to transform an array of data into an array of JSX elements?
 
 #### --distractors--
 
-Vue.js
+`forEach()`
 
 ---
 
-Angular
+`filter()`
 
 ---
 
-Svelte
+`reduce()`
 
 #### --answer--
 
-Next.js
+`map()`
 
 ### --question--
 
 #### --text--
 
-What tool would you use to bootstrap a new React project?
+Which of the following is the best practice for passing the `key` prop in React?
 
 #### --distractors--
 
-Webpack
+Use array indexes in all cases.
 
 ---
 
-npm
+Randomly generate keys on each render.
 
 ---
 
-Babel
+Omit the `key` prop altogether.
 
 #### --answer--
 
-Vite
+Use unique and stable IDs from the data.
 
 ### --question--
